Description: Ostracon, section (three fragments joined) of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the interior is slightly grooved and covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.100-101)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87608) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87608)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 110 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
